Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.DesignerSerializer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.TableLayoutControlCollectionCodeDomSerializer, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", "System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomSerializer, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of child controls in a table layout container.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection> class represents the collection of all the child controls in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> control. This collection is exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.Controls%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> class. You can manage and individually manipulate members of the table layout panel through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection> exposed by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.Controls%2A>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection> class is a minor specialization of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel container) cil managed

Docs.param: The control that contains the control collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Generally, the application programmer will not directly create instances of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection> class. Instead, a reference to an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection> is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.Controls%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Add (System.Windows.Forms.Control control, int column, int row);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Add(class System.Windows.Forms.Control control, int32 column, int32 row) cil managed

Docs.param: The column in which control will be placed.
The row in which control will be placed.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified control to the collection and positions it at the specified cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks With <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection.Add%2A>, you can specify the cell position of `control`. You can assign `control` to a specific cell by providing both the `column` and `row` parameters, or you can specify only the column or row value and let the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.LayoutEngine%2A> place `control` at the next open cell. This is known as letting the control *flow* to its position in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> control.
Set `column` to -1 if you want `control` to occupy a fixed row position.
Set `row` to -1 if you want `control` to occupy a fixed column position.
If neither `column` nor `row` is -1, `control` will be added at the absolute position given by (`column`, `row`).
If you set both `column` and `row` to -1, `control` will flow to the first open position, with the specific flow behavior defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.GrowStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> value. This is equivalent to using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
To get to the actual current position of a control, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.GetPositionFromControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. This method takes into account the entire <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> control state, including column or row spanning and when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.LayoutEngine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> has placed a control with its `Column` and `Row` properties set to -1.

Docs.summary: Gets the parent that contains the controls in the collection.
Docs.value: The that contains the controls in the current collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
